citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A current/updated written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) was not available for inspection; PVC presented for
inspection was from calendar year 2019. In order to comply with this section of the Animal Welfare Act (AWA), a recently
updated written PVC by the Attending Veterinarian (AV) must be in place and available for inspection at all times. Also,
the facility must ensure the AV conducts regularly scheduled visits to the premises where regulated animals are kept. To
ensure adequate veterinary medical care to regulated animals, the facility's PVC must be regularly updated.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by July 23, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
n

narrative:
2.40(a)(1) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A current/updated written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) was not available for inspection; PVC presented for 
inspection was from calendar year 2019.  In order to comply with this section of the Animal Welfare Act (AWA), a recently 
updated written PVC by the Attending Veterinarian (AV) must be in place and available for inspection at all times.  Also, 
the facility must ensure the AV conducts regularly scheduled visits to the premises where regulated animals are kept.  To 
ensure adequate veterinary medical care to regulated animals, the facility's PVC must be regularly updated. 
 
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “A” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the 
applicant. 
 
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by July 23, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license fee 
and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection. 
 
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires. 
 
 n
